td.content: s:a white female aged 54 years presents with Blood. o:Height 62 in, Weight 112 lbs, Temperature 98.3 F, Pulse 78, SystolicBP 112, DiastolicBP 72, Respiration 17, Arteriogram of the upper and lower extremities shows multiple small and medium-sized arterial occlusions with formation of compensatory corkscrew collaterals a:Buergers Disease p:administered Ultram - 50 mg po q6h prn, clindamycin - 150 mg po q 6h, performed Arteriogram of the upper and lower extremities, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.

s:55 YO white F blacksmith complains of recurrent Blood over the past month. consumes more than 4 alcoholic drinks daily patient reports that she smokes once or twice daily o:Height 62 in, Weight 111 lbs, Temperature 98.4 F, Pulse 84, SystolicBP 112, DiastolicBP 70, Respiration 15 a:Buergers Disease p:performed E/M Level 3 (new patient) - Completed, and referred patient to hematology.

content2.Unmatched: daily patient reports that she smokes once or twice daily

td.content: s:F blacksmith aged 55 yrs presents with 12 days history of Blood. she has approx. a 30 pack/year history of smoking she drinks alcohol heavily for the past 2 years o:Height 62 in, Weight 110 lbs, Temperature 98.3 F, Pulse 84, SystolicBP 110, DiastolicBP 68, Respiration 15 a:Buergers Disease p:performed E/M Level 3 (new patient) - Completed, and prescribed Naproxen - 250 mg po q 12h prn, Chantix - 1 mg po bid x 11 weeks, pentoxifylline - 400 mg po tid, and ordered Sympathectomy - thoracic trunk.
